BiomeDef.label: urban ruins in tundra
BiomeDef.description: These mostly-frozen plains with almost no trees and little vegetation surround the ruins of an ancient dwelling. There are a few small animals interspersed with large herds of migratory grazers and their predators.

BiomeDef.label: urban ruins in boreal forest
BiomeDef.description: Forests of coniferous trees surround the ruins of an ancient dwelling. Despite the harsh winters, boreal forests sustain a diverse population of small and large animals, and have warm summers. Snow makes it extremely slow to travel in winter.

BiomeDef.label: urban ruins on ice sheets
BiomeDef.description: Sheets of ice which can be kilometers thick the ruins of an ancient dwelling. There is no soil for plants to grow in. The only animals here are migrating to somewhere else - or badly lost.
